meanings.definition: A person who asserts or makes a statement.
meanings.sent1: The assertors in the meeting shared their opinions confidently.
meanings.sent2: The assertors in the debate made strong arguments to support their views.
meanings.sent3: The assertors at the party were not shy about expressing their thoughts.
meanings.sent4: She stood out as an assertor among the group, always speaking her mind.
meanings.sent5: The assertors in the courtroom made sure their voices were heard.

meanings.definition: Those who confidently state or declare something.
meanings.sent1: Assertors in the courtroom presented their case with conviction.
meanings.sent2: The assertors in the class discussion were not afraid to voice their opinions.
meanings.sent3: The assertors at the town hall meeting made sure their voices were heard.
meanings.sent4: He emerged as the assertor in the group, leading the discussion with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The assertors in the team meeting were determined to reach a consensus.
